result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob J. Dubois

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ma] Cases 20CF319, 21CF352, 21CF626, 22CF283, 22CF388 called at 2:17pm 
Defendant Jacob J. Dubois in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Jacob J. Dubois.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " is entered on Count #1 of Case 20CF319; factual basis is stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Count #2 of Case 20CF319, 21CF352, 21CF626 and Uncharged DA Case 21JE2308

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Counsel

On Count #1 of Case 20CF319, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve 10 months jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--Days credit for time already served: 84 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process

--To pay fine of $1000+ costs= $2323.  The Court grants the Defendant 30 days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in entry of civil judgment. 
--DNA sample provision
--Revocation of drivers license for 33 months
--AODA assessment and follow through 
--Victim Impact Panel attendance 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 33 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed
recess: 2:45pm 

NEXT: As to Cases 22CF283 & 22CF388, Plea & Sentencing on 11/18/22 at 2:00pm

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ma] Cases 20CF319, 21CF352, 21CF626, 22CF283, 22CF388 called at 9:57 AM 
Defendant Jacob J. Dubois in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Jacob J. Dubois.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF388:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint 

The Court requires a $1000   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--maintain absolute sobriety
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.** 

Arraignment occurs in Case 22CF283:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 10:05am  


NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/12/22 at 8:30am   (2) Status Conference on 11/1/22 at 2:00pm
